summary: Sharon Carter é uma mulher simples, que após casar com Tony Stark, teve sua vida completamente mudada. Juntos, eles levam uma...
caption:
Sharon Carter é uma mulher simples, que após casar com Tony Stark, teve sua vida completamente mudada. Juntos, eles levam uma vida simples, onde dia após dia, tem o amor crescendo dentro de coração de cada um. Como fruto desse amor, eles tem um filho, Ethan, que se torna a prioridade para os dois.

Mesmo com todas as dificuldades, eles podem mostrar que a família vale mais do que tudo nessa vida, mas um acidente provocado por Tony, muda os planos de todos.

Sharon, sua amada esposa perde a memória em um acidente que ele mesmo causou, e agora, ele precisa mostrar a ela a beleza da vida, a apoiando em todos os momentos, na tentativa de fazer sua esposa se apaixonar por ele mais uma vez, e fazer com que ela ame o filho, como amava antes de se esquecer de tudo, mesmo que ela nunca mais se lembre da sua vida antiga.

Hospedada: Wattpad, Spirit, Nyah!

title: Count Your Blessings 22
body:
Pairing: Steve Rogers x Reader

Warnings: Language. Lies. Friends with Benefits. Possessiveness. Fights. Kidnapping. Small amount of violence.

OKAY!! Just a heads up there is no abuse in this story from Steve. He’s written as an alpha male. Yes he’s possessive of his family and the woman he loves, but NOT ABUSIVE. If you’re reading that, than we really need to have a long talk so feel free to send me a message.

TAG LIST : If your name is crossed out. Check your settings before I remove you from the list. Please and Thank you. I did remove peaches, because I can’t tag them just an FYI.

“Anyone else got a nasty feeling about this?” Buck asks from his place reading the paper outside the shop next to where Y/N was supposed to be meeting Brad.

“Speaking to my gut brother.” Steve swallows.

“Maybe he’s late?” Peter wonders from the truck.

“Call Y/N.” Luke growls. Steve snatches his phone from his pocket hitting redial. No answer.

“Nothing.” Steve swallows.

“Nope. Nope. I call smoke.” Sam sighs. “We’re three hours from home. He smoked us.” Sam almost sounded panicked.

“Buck call Nat, send her over to check the house.” Steve demands. Standing up and heading out of the bakery.

“Peter you better drive fast.” Buck grumbles as they all head for the truck abandoning their positions.


“Nat says the house is locked up and her car is gone.” Buck sighs from the back seat.

“No. She wouldn’t go without answering her phone. She knows.” Steve shakes his head. He grabs his phone from the cup holder, dialing quickly. “Tony.” Steve glances out the window.

“What can I do for you Rogers?” Tony chuckles.

“Y/N’s not answering her phone.” He swallows the bile in the back of his throat.

“Wanda isn’t either.” Sam sucks in a deep breathe.

“Same for Wanda. The girls were supposed to be shopping with Ari today. Can’t get a hold of them.” He explains. “Do me a favor, track their phones?” His jaw clenching.

“On it. I’ll call back with the locations.” Tony was suddenly serious.

“Thanks.” Steve jabs end, shifting in his seat. “Can you speed it up?” He looks over at Peter.

“Steve, I’m doing Ninety on the high way. I go any faster and I won’t be able to weave in and out of traffic.” Peter tips his head briefly.

“Fine.” Steve nods.



“Brad.” You shake, squeezing your crying daughter.

“We’re going for a trip.” Brad points the gun at you.

“Okay. There is no need for that.” Your voice shakes.

“Your right, if you just weren’t a lying whore.” He growls. “Move now!” He snaps.

“I need the diaper bag.” You shake as you point to the bag next to the door where Wanda lies unmoving. Brad snatches it up, before he points the gun at your side and shoves you out the front door.

“Put her in the car.” He demands. You nod, putting Ari in her seat as she screams and cries. You hand her Jr. Theo’s replacement, she clings on weeping into it.

“It’s okay baby. We’re fine.” You brush her hair back from her face. Your voice shakes and sound unsure, doing nothing to calm her.

“Climb in.” He waves the gun at you. Brad shoves two overnight bags into the back with Ari before he slams the door shut.

“You point that thing at her and I’ll kill you myself.” You warn him as you scoot across the seat into the passenger seat.

“You sure you won’t have your little biker fuck buddy do it for you?” He chuckles, getting in behind the wheel. He starts your truck, backing out.

“You harm a hair on my child’s head and I won’t need Steve. You’ll find out what mommy rage really is.” You sneer at him.

“You’re a balls bitch Y/N.” He chuckles.

“You’re a dead bitch Brad.” You smirk at him.

“Actually, you’ll be the dead bitch if your little boyfriend and his gang of fuck boys don’t give up the code.” His lips curl up.

“Pathetic little man, you failed to realize you couldn’t get into the safe you stole. Boy, you’re a smart cookie.” You smirk. His hand lashes out and slams into your face, your head hits the window. Ari screams louder, crying out Momma, over and over.

“SHUT UP!” Brad’s voice fills the car, as he shouts.

“It’s fine.” You reach back grabbing Ari’s hand. “It’s okay.” You try to comfort her.

“It will be when you get a hold of that fucker.” Brad growls.

“You speak like that to my daughter and I’ll crash this fucking car.” You hiss at him.

“You wouldn’t dare.” Brad glances at you.

“She’s strapped in, top of the line car seat. I’ll wreck this bitch. Try me.” You growl low enough just for him to hear. He swallows, gripping the wheel harder. “That’s what I thought.” You settle back into your seat, trying to think of a way to get out of this without getting Ari hurt. Your heartaches for Wanda, oh god she couldn’t die, she just couldn’t.



“Wanda’s phone is pinging at your house Steve.” Tony sighs. “Y/N’s is, well that’s a different story.” He clears his throat.

“Where is she Tony?!” Steve slams his hand down on the dash.

“She’s heading back where you were.” He admits softly.

“Fuck.” Steve’s stomach drops.

“Hey, hey!!!” Buck’s yelling as they slow on the street of the house.

“What?” Peter slams on the breaks.

“THAT’S THE TRUCK!” Buck shouts jumping out of the truck. Steve’s head whips around, spotting Brad’s red truck. “It’s cold!” Buck kicks the tire. Steve’s phone hits the floor boards, as he stumbles out of the truck, running towards the house. His keys in hand, Y/N’s car gone, he throws the door open, in the dark he can see the shadow of the body on the floor. His hand hits the light switch and he drops to his knees, gathering her up in his arms.

“Wanda. Come on, wake up doll. Wake up for me.” He pats her cheeks. “WANDA WAKE UP!” He shouts. Sam’s stumbling up the steps of the porch, dropping to his knees next to Steve.

“Move morons!” Luke scoops her up in his arms moving towards the couch, he tips her head, feeling for a pulse before he puts his ear to her chest.

“Yeah, yeah, four houses in from the corner. She’s not responsive.” Peter’s yelling into his phone. Steve jumps up running up the stairs, throwing open their bedroom door, checking the bathroom. He pauses for a moment, something on the bathroom counter that caught his attention. He holds the box in his hands, nodding before he sets it back down heading out of the room again and storming down the stairs.

“Ari’s gone too. This fuck has my daughter and my girl.” Steve looks around. “Sam stay with Wanda. Someone call Barton. I’m putting this fuck down.” He lays down his authority. The guys nod, heading for the door.

“Call us when you know she’s okay!” Buck yells back at Sam as the ambulance rolls up.

“In the living room.” Peter directs them before they jump into the truck and peel out.

“Steve, I’m doing Ninety on the high way. I go any faster and I won’t be able to weave in and out of traffic.” Peter tips his head briefly.

“Fine.” Steve nods.



“Brad.” You shake, squeezing your crying daughter.

“We’re going for a trip.” Brad points the gun at you.

“Okay. There is no need for that.” Your voice shakes.

“Your right, if you just weren’t a lying whore.” He growls. “Move now!” He snaps.

“I need the diaper bag.” You shake as you point to the bag next to the door where Wanda lies unmoving. Brad snatches it up, before he points the gun at your side and shoves you out the front door.

“Put her in the car.” He demands. You nod, putting Ari in her seat as she screams and cries. You hand her Jr. Theo’s replacement, she clings on weeping into it.

“It’s okay baby. We’re fine.” You brush her hair back from her face. Your voice shakes and sound unsure, doing nothing to calm her.

“Climb in.” He waves the gun at you. Brad shoves two overnight bags into the back with Ari before he slams the door shut.

“You point that thing at her and I’ll kill you myself.” You warn him as you scoot across the seat into the passenger seat.

“You sure you won’t have your little biker fuck buddy do it for you?” He chuckles, getting in behind the wheel. He starts your truck, backing out.

“You harm a hair on my child’s head and I won’t need Steve. You’ll find out what mommy rage really is.” You sneer at him.

“You’re a balls bitch Y/N.” He chuckles.

“You’re a dead bitch Brad.” You smirk at him.

“Actually, you’ll be the dead bitch if your little boyfriend and his gang of fuck boys don’t give up the code.” His lips curl up.

“Pathetic little man, you failed to realize you couldn’t get into the safe you stole. Boy, you’re a smart cookie.” You smirk. His hand lashes out and slams into your face, your head hits the window. Ari screams louder, crying out Momma, over and over.

“SHUT UP!” Brad’s voice fills the car, as he shouts.

“It’s fine.” You reach back grabbing Ari’s hand. “It’s okay.” You try to comfort her.

“It will be when you get a hold of that fucker.” Brad growls.

“You speak like that to my daughter and I’ll crash this fucking car.” You hiss at him.

“You wouldn’t dare.” Brad glances at you.

“She’s strapped in, top of the line car seat. I’ll wreck this bitch. Try me.” You growl low enough just for him to hear. He swallows, gripping the wheel harder. “That’s what I thought.” You settle back into your seat, trying to think of a way to get out of this without getting Ari hurt. Your heartaches for Wanda, oh god she couldn’t die, she just couldn’t.



“Wanda’s phone is pinging at your house Steve.” Tony sighs. “Y/N’s is, well that’s a different story.” He clears his throat.

“Where is she Tony?!” Steve slams his hand down on the dash.

“She’s heading back where you were.” He admits softly.

“Fuck.” Steve’s stomach drops.

“Hey, hey!!!” Buck’s yelling as they slow on the street of the house.

“What?” Peter slams on the breaks.

“THAT’S THE TRUCK!” Buck shouts jumping out of the truck. Steve’s head whips around, spotting Brad’s red truck. “It’s cold!” Buck kicks the tire. Steve’s phone hits the floor boards, as he stumbles out of the truck, running towards the house. His keys in hand, Y/N’s car gone, he throws the door open, in the dark he can see the shadow of the body on the floor. His hand hits the light switch and he drops to his knees, gathering her up in his arms.

“Wanda. Come on, wake up doll. Wake up for me.” He pats her cheeks. “WANDA WAKE UP!” He shouts. Sam’s stumbling up the steps of the porch, dropping to his knees next to Steve.

“Move morons!” Luke scoops her up in his arms moving towards the couch, he tips her head, feeling for a pulse before he puts his ear to her chest.

“Yeah, yeah, four houses in from the corner. She’s not responsive.” Peter’s yelling into his phone. Steve jumps up running up the stairs, throwing open their bedroom door, checking the bathroom. He pauses for a moment, something on the bathroom counter that caught his attention. He holds the box in his hands, nodding before he sets it back down heading out of the room again and storming down the stairs.

“Ari’s gone too. This fuck has my daughter and my girl.” Steve looks around. “Sam stay with Wanda. Someone call Barton. I’m putting this fuck down.” He lays down his authority. The guys nod, heading for the door.

“Call us when you know she’s okay!” Buck yells back at Sam as the ambulance rolls up.

“In the living room.” Peter directs them before they jump into the truck and peel out.

summary: It’s true what they say about the world ENDING -It goes not with a B A N G but with a whisper.   We’ve all lost something,...
caption:
It’s true what they say about the world ENDING -It goes not with a B A N G but with a whisper.

 We’ve all lost something, someone, some part of ourselves that feels impossible to get back.  How can the earth keep turning without the missing?And somewhere, deep within the recesses of the Soul Stone, lies a secret world, a pocket dimension where those who turned to ash in the Snap went.  Two parallel worlds hang in the balance as those trapped inside yearn to break free, and those on the outside search in desperation to break in.  Are you strong enough to join in the fight for not just one dimension, but two? Do you have what it takes to escape an infinity stone?

* SoulStoneHQ is a literate and welcoming post Infinity War roleplay group devoted to world-building and character development. In this group we have two categories, deceased and alive. The deceased characters can interact only with other deceased characters from where they’re trapped inside the Soul Stone’s pocket dimension. The live characters can interact only with live characters from where they have set up shop in the real world. The characters trapped in the Soul World will eventually find their way free of its clutches, but not without hardship and struggle. Do you have what it takes to escape an Infinity Stone?

Main◆Plot◆Characters◆Rules◆Questions

caption: This was probably too ambitious for me since I just started practicing, but I drew Cloak & Dagger! I really liked the first few episodes. Cloak turned out pretty well. Probably because I didn’t have to draw his body.

blog.title: Starting my own comic: StarCross
blog.description: It's a SEGA fancomic about understanding yourself, others, the world around you, and coming to your own conclusions (with some sweet fights to boot!)

tags: Y'all thought I wouldn't tag em all
summary: I don’t even close to understand what this dream meant, but here we go
title: I don’t even close to understand what this dream meant, but here we go
body:
The following contains Overwatch, Marvel comics, Boruto, and RWBY, and none of it makes any sense.

So, it starts off with Overwatch, right?

So some people are escorting a payload, and it’s on Junkertown, and you have to remember that these are the real characters in this dream, not people playing a game. Zenyatta’s there, and he’s on the payload, but his team is being held up at the corner right after the big health pack in the shed at the start. But then Zenyatta does Transcendence, and they’re able to push. So Zenyatta is sitting on the payload, but Widowmaker is on the enemy team, and about to line him up and kill him. That’s when Tracer gets on the payload with Zenyatta, and starts running and jumping around him so Widow can’t line up the shot (instead of just like telling Zenyatta about Widow and having him move, but hey whatever), because she can just recall if she gets shot. So right when the payload gets to the first checkpoint, it stops being Junkertown, and now it’s like some floor in a hotel, and it’s got a red carpet (not a rug like “the red carpet” is, but an actual full on red carpeting) and there were three elevators. The payload was in front of one elevator, and Widow was still trying to shoot Zenyatta (from where? I don’t know, it wasn’t specified).

And this is where it gets weird.

Flying out in the middle of the night around the building where the payload is, is the Sam Wilson version of Captain America (which was something I didn’t realize until I woke up and was able to properly ID this weird red white and blue guy who was flying around), who is on his way to meet up with Boruto Uzumaki and Sarada Uchiha, and it’s important to note that I’VE NEVER WATCHED OR READ BORUTO A DAY IN MY LIFE. I didn’t even watch the movie, and I’ve seen sporadic clips here and there. But yeah, he’s got a picture of Sarada and she’s got some weird sigil on her forehead that was apparently words, because my brain tried to interpret them, and Sam called her whatever that sigil was supposed to say, and he said it clear as day. As a matter of fact, I only know Boruto was involved in this because my brain told me he was, because BORUTO NEVER SHOWS UP OR IS EVEN MENTIONED IN THIS DREAM. So anyway, he’s flying around the building where the payload is, right? Just coincidentally. But then someone on comm-unit contacts him and explains the situation with Widowmaker. So he lands on the building, and immediately enacts some security protocols that shield the building in some way, and that takes care of Widow I guess. And he’s talking to the protocols and says something like “Let me know if any unauthorized persona gets inside the building.” So he’s already put protocols in place but he goes inside anyway.

BUT HE GOES INSIDE BY CUTTING THROUGH THE WINDOW WITH A LASER HE MOST CERTAINLY DOESN’T HAVE. And then the alarms go off, and he’s like “I didn’t mean if it was me.” And the alarms turn off.

Remember when I said it would get weird? Well, Zenyatta is gone. And then the elevator in front of the payload, which is still there, opens up, and some Avenger who does not exist anywhere in canon shows up, and then over on the payload is Tracer, and she shows relief when this Avenger shows up, because apparently Tracer’s in the Avengers now – and did I forget to mention I favor DC over Marvel? Why I was dreaming about the Avengers, I don’t know. Anyway, it turns out Tracer got comfortable too early, because this Avenger had gone rogue, and started attacking them. Pretty soon both she and this nondescript Avenger both completely disappear, and from the elevators behind the payload come a whole bunch of these guys with guns, so Sam has to go quietly, but they’re lobbing racial and homosexual slurs at him, which doesn’t make sense because Sam isn’t gay, but maybe this is a holdover from the fact that Tracer is, and she existed within this dream at some point. So Sam surrenders, right? But then outside the building, Magneto’s floating and he sees the whole thing going on, and he’s like “Oh no. I can’t let this happen.” (Because if you weren’t aware, he’s been a good guy for a while in the comics, at least last time I checked)

So he comes into the building, and I have no idea what happens next, because all of a sudden, we’re transported to Sarada Uchiha and Kakashi Hatake, and Sarada doesn’t have that sigil from earlier, so I guess we’re just not gonna talk about that. And just to give a bit of an update if you dropped off during Naruto, or otherwise haven’t seen recent material, but both of Kakashi’s eyes work just fine now, so he doesn’t have to constantly cover a Sharingan eye.

But he and Sarada are in like some military base, and it’s snowing, and they seem to be behind enemy lines, and they haven’t been discovered, but they can’t wait for Captain America any longer. So they realize they’re gonna have to be real sneaky about this, so Kakashi comes to the conclusion that he needs to cover his eye like he did back in the day in order to accomplish this, so he pulls his headband down, and for a moment he’s having a problem remembering which direction his hair is supposed to be pointing over the headband, even though it’s pointing in the same direction as it always has been. So they start sneaking out, but they get caught almost immediately. But then they manage to lose the people who caught them because they saw some girl swinging in circles on a street lamp, and decided to do the same thing with a lamp that was nearby, but Sarada disguised herself as a red bag of food (which I believe included out-of-the-packaging pizza rolls and pretzels) and Kakashi disguised himself as like a twelve year old boy and tied the Sarada bag of food to his ankle before he started swinging around the pole. Then some soldiers told them to get down and they threw the “bag of food” into a wheelbarrow with other actual bags of food, and Kakashi was told he had to help push the wheelbarrow through a tunnel on some train tracks (I assume in order to get the supplies to some allies who needed them), and no I don’t know why they accepted this weird little boy and just told him to do some work. Not sure what happened to that little girl, but hey. So while Kakashi and the soldiers are pushing the wheelbarrow, and one of them makes a White Rose joke about the red food bag and the snow, which is so loose a connection, but hey, and if you’re not sure what that is, let me explain that it’s a pairing in the series RWBY (which is weird because I don’t ship White Rose). But the important thing here is that since they made that joke, it’s rather clear that RWBY is a fictional series here, right? That they’re not real people? That’s fair to assume.

So anyway, we cut to a little bit later with no closure on what was going on, but still with Kakashi and Sarada, and we see that they’re being led around by someone who’s on their side, and of course that person is an older version of Ruby Rose, the protagonist of RWBY. And that’s it. It ended there. Not sure what happened to Zenyatta, Widowmaker, Tracer, Captain America, the unnamed Avenger, Magneto, those guys in black, Boruto, the little girl swinging on the pole, or those soldiers, but apparently Ruby’s working with Kakashi and Sarada to do something, and I have no idea what.

So anyway, we cut to a little bit later with no closure on what was going on, but still with Kakashi and Sarada, and we see that they’re being led around by someone who’s on their side, and of course that person is an older version of Ruby Rose, the protagonist of RWBY. And that’s it. It ended there. Not sure what happened to Zenyatta, Widowmaker, Tracer, Captain America, the unnamed Avenger, Magneto, those guys in black, Boruto, the little girl swinging on the pole, or those soldiers, but apparently Ruby’s working with Kakashi and Sarada to do something, and I have no idea what.
trail.content_abstract:
The following contains Overwatch, Marvel comics, Boruto, and RWBY, and none of it makes any sense.

So, it starts off with Overwatch, right?

So some people are escorting a payload, and it’s on Junkertown, and you have to remember that these are the real characters in this dream, not people playing a game. Zenyatta’s there, and he’s on the payload, but his team is being held up at the corner right after the big health pack in the shed at the start. But then Zenyatta does Transcendence, and they’re able to push. So Zenyatta is sitting on the payload, but Widowmaker is on the enemy team, and about to line him up and kill him. That’s when Tracer gets on the payload with Zenyatta, and starts running and jumping around him so Widow can’t line up the shot (instead of just like telling Zenyatta about Widow and having him move, but hey whatever), because she can just recall if she gets shot. So right when the payload gets to the first checkpoint, it stops being Junkertown, and now it’s like some floor in a hotel, and it’s got a red carpet (not a rug like “the red carpet” is, but an actual full on red carpeting) and there were three elevators. The payload was in front of one elevator, and Widow was still trying to shoot Zenyatta (from where? I don’t know, it wasn’t specified).

And this is where it gets weird.
